metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.code_html:
Property Description
checkValidity() Returns true if an input element contains valid data.
setCustomValidity() Sets the validationMessage property of an input element.

content.text: If an input field contains invalid data, display a message:
content.html: If an input field contains invalid data, display a message:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
function myFunction() {  const inpObj = document.getElementById("id1");  if (!inpObj.checkValidity()) {    document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = inpObj.validationMessage;
    }}

syntax_highlighting.text:
function myFunction() {  const inpObj = document.getElementById("id1");  if (!inpObj.checkValidity()) {    document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = inpObj.validationMessage;
    }}

content.code_html:
<input id="id1" type="number" min="100" max="300" required>
<button onclick="myFunction()">OK</button>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
function myFunction() {
  const inpObj = document.getElementById("id1");
  if (!inpObj.checkValidity()) {
    document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = inpObj.validationMessage;
  }
}
</script>

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
function myFunction() {  const inpObj = document.getElementById("id1");  if (!inpObj.checkValidity()) {    document.getElementById("demo").innerHTML = inpObj.validationMessage;
    }}

content.code_html:
Property Description
validity Contains boolean properties related to the validity of an input element.
validationMessage Contains the message a browser will display when the validity is false.
willValidate Indicates if an input element will be validated.

content.text: The validity property of an input element contains a number of properties related to the validity of data:
content.html: The validity property of an input element contains a number of properties related to the validity of data:

content.code_html:
Property Description
customError Set to true, if a custom validity message is set.
patternMismatch Set to true, if an element's value does not match its pattern attribute.
rangeOverflow Set to true, if an element's value is greater than its max attribute.
rangeUnderflow Set to true, if an element's value is less than its min attribute.
stepMismatch Set to true, if an element's value is invalid per its step attribute.
tooLong Set to true, if an element's value exceeds its maxLength attribute.
typeMismatch Set to true, if an element's value is invalid per its type attribute.
valueMissing Set to true, if an element (with a required attribute) has no value.
valid Set to true, if an element's value is valid.

content.text: If the number in an input field is greater than 100 (the input's max attribute), display a message:
content.html: If the number in an input field is greater than 100 (the input's max attribute), display a message:

content.code_html:
<input id="id1" type="number" max="100">
<button onclick="myFunction()">OK</button>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
function myFunction() {
  let text = "Value OK";
  if (document.getElementById("id1").validity.rangeOverflow) {
    text = "Value too large";
  }
}
</script>

content.text: If the number in an input field is less than 100 (the input's min attribute), display a message:
content.html: If the number in an input field is less than 100 (the input's min attribute), display a message:

content.code_html:
<input id="id1" type="number" min="100">
<button onclick="myFunction()">OK</button>

<p id="demo"></p>

<script>
function myFunction() {
  let text = "Value OK";
  if (document.getElementById("id1").validity.rangeUnderflow) {
    text = "Value too small";
  }
}
</script>
